comment: Just took Dr. Keleher online for Spring 2025, and SHEEESH. Best teacher I've had since coming to Kennesaw. His work load is average and his feedback literally fixes your paper for you. He also does something called "Free Friday" or something, but basically you can submit any late work you missed and he'll grade it. TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Took him for fall 2024. He was caring & genuinely did like teaching. Class was easy, only 3 essays & online hw due at the end of semester. A little strict grading papers but not bad, still got good grades. Only complaint is his lectures did get pretty boring & he tends to get sidetracked a lot. But when he has group activities they're engaging.

He loves teaching. As long as you pay attention and do your work on time you'll be fine. He's always happy to answer questions and help. I will say his feedback/grading criteria can be spotty or strange but somewhat makes sense.

He's fine, just pretty boring. Does honestly care about his students, and is very nice. Goes on tangents for entire class periods. Assignments are easy and straightforward, obviously super picky about format like most english teachers. Attendance is mandatory, but late work is accepted with no dock (within reason)

Michael Keleher was caring, gave fair assignments, and valued student input. However, he prefers simple presentations, favoring a basic style with a white background and minimal design. Despite this, he remains an excellent professor to have for English 1101.

Dr. Keleher was a great professor for an incoming freshman. He tried to relate to the class and graded fairly on assignments. If you participate and show up he will like you and be lenient on late work.

Willing to work with students on late work, proof-read all my papers, and has an open emailing system for any questions. His homework is online and left to do ourselves (the better you score on the 1st test, the less homework you have). The textbook is required, but is available through Day One Access (I found a pdf of it) 10/10!

I really enjoyed this course with Dr. Keleher. Hes super nice and always reply's to e-mails fast and is understanding if you cant make it. 3 major essays over the semester and they are not hard. If you go to class and listen to what you have to do, youll get an A or B. Would recommend.

Keleher hasn't taught English in a while, and it really shows. He is out of touch with his students and the world, and it makes learning new material difficult. He also gives frustratingly vague feedback, and it is very nitpicky. Don't take him if you're not good at English classes, because neither is he.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not fall for his I care for you act. He really doesnt. He is no help. Theres always something he doesnt like and hell make sure to knock points off. You wont get an A in his class. Not worth it. He doesnt even teach! He just reads off a broad PowerPoint and gives you a broad rubric but expects you to understand the prompt and do well.

I really liked taking this course with Dr. Keleher as my professor. Responds to emails really fast. Has live collaborate ultra meetings every Thursday. Really is there for you if you need any kind of help. Dont forgot to complete the discussion posts. Not a whole lot of assignments and a overall good professor to have.

Dont take him. Thats all I can advise. He is awful. Simply awful. He lived to play like a nice guy in our faces but in reality he couldnt care less whether or not you fail. He doesnt do anything to gives his students an extra help. Take him if you dont want an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Mandatory lectures aren't terrible, and as other people have said he is nice during lectures. I missed a single lecture and was completely lost on one of the major essays, I emailed him and didn't receive a reply for two days. It is very unclear what he wants you to do on most assignments, no actual description/prompt. Avoid for 1101.

Really chill and sweet teacher. He always asks us how we're doing and always makes his instructions very clear. I wish more people would talk in class, because I feel bad. Papers are very clear regarding how do to them, and he has very engaging classes. He does however ask us to use strictly D2L, but that's not bad.

I took this instructor for Internship. We were required to do weekly discussions, submit time sheets upon request, and occasional papers. he is the only instructor for internship.. His communication is strange, and he expects you to understand exactly what he wants and how he wants it. Very vague syllabus and rubrics. Would NOT take him again.

Super chill guy. Low key hilarious, I would be nearly crying from some of the stuff he would say. He gave us an extra credit that bumped me a letter grade. This is NOT an easy class, don't take if you want an easy A. I made a 720 on the SAT writing and was still sweating it but it's worth it. He will absolutely make you a better writer.
No tests or quizzes and essays were able to be revised and resubmitted.  Though it was an easy class, it helped me a lot with my writing skills.

Mrs Keleher is pedagogue and spontaneous. he gives you the envy to learn and help you to understand the texts. We have a quiz every week but there are not difficult as soon as you do your homework. He is really great. this teacher is definitely a good teacher.

Don't take Dr. Keleher if you want an A! He lets you revise your papers and turn them back in, but he averages the grades together. I rewrote every paper twice, and I still got a B. I asked for extra credit or something else that I could do, and he told me to simply "work really hard on the last two papers." Doesn't care whether or not you succeed.

He does expect a short and sweet writing style. He rarely gives out A's, but I got one on my second paper after quite a bit of work. So I felt like I knew what he was looking for. On my third paper, however, he decided to change my thesis to better fit what he wanted me to write about. Results: B on the paper and confusion as to how to write well.

I never had such a hard time in an English class.I did all the assignments and attended every class. He isn't very clear on his guidelines. & grades to only one writing style, his. Hated going to class b/c we would have class discussions where he would ony talk for the 1 hr 15 mins! Don't take him if you need or want an "A"!
He is very unclear in what he is looking for in each paper. He also has a definate writing style that he sticks to. You have to write the paper as he would or it is incorrect.

Average class, Dr. Keleher is a good teacher, but he has a very specific writing style (short and simple) and does not ever stop to consider that other people write differently than him. He is a bit arrogant as well, always thinks he is right, will get on your nerves if you have a strong personality
He is helpful and cool teacher.

mr.keleher is awesome ! he is the BEST , if you can take him ! he is understand & works with you . genuinely cares about the students & the course . i recommend him to anyone struggling in english . probably my favorite professor ! truly awesome .

Mr. Keleher is a really good teacher if you are going to take any english learning support classes. He lets you know up front what he wants from you and what the test are going to be over. The best part his test are only 10 questions and they are easy if you read the short stories.

I enjoyed this class very much.  Mr. Keleher is a great teacher.  Very helpful, patient, and explains very clearly what he expects.  Go to class, participate, and complete the assignments.  I highly recommend him.

Laid back guy. Didnt show up to class several times. Lets you re write your papers as many times as you want. We watched some movies in class. I wrote a paper that was 3 pages and got an A. My friend wrote a 5 page paper and got a B. He likes short and sweet writing

TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN! I am a terrible writer and I still managed to get an A in this class. It's a joke, we hardly did anything in class and we only had 4 papers. He likes simple writing, so honestly, don't try too hard.

this class is all essays. the topics did not seem difficult to write about, but even after like 3 rough drafts...he still finds something he doesn't like in about every paragraph. he is a laid back guy, but i do not recommend him.

worst teacher...i changed my major after taking this class. he lets you re write the essays as many times as you like however he basically makes you write the way he wants otherwise you dont make a good grade. i dont recommend him.
I really did not like this teacher. Sometimes he seemed to be a little arrogant. He grades the essays really hard. I do NOT reccomend taking him for this class

Best professor I've had so far. Very understanding and easy to talk to. Essay topics are rather easy, just make sure you stay away from passive voice. Doesn't teach from the textbook too much, just uses it for examples and outside reading to make sure your understand the concept. He's a pretty decent guy. GET 'IM!!!
He only has a few assignments for the entire semester.  He doesnt just give away A's but and A is attainable.  I would recommend him for sure.
Highly recommend him. Good-Reasonable guy.
Good class, def. reccomend him for freshmen english. He lets you rewrite most of your papers, and grades them not so strictly.
Very nice man!

Very clear, professional teacher. Really knows his stuff. If you are registering for classes, I would DEFINITELY try to get him. Not very many grades in the class, but he lets you rewrite to make up for a bad paper. Only had 3 papers, each pretty easy. Very involved lectures, you can tell he really likes picking his students' brains! GET HIM!
This teacher is fairly easy, and the class is pretty easy as well. He assigns a few papers, and also gives you the chance to fix them for a new grade. He grades fairly easy as well.
ok class, hard but not too hard if you like english and writing which i dont. do your essays and re-writes help too...
Great teacher!! If u go to class most of the time u will do great!

Very good instructor. May come off as arrogant however he has the right to be because he knows his stuff and you will learn a lot from him. extremely helpful, very clear, and understanding,gives you chances to rewrite a paper and clear on what you need to focus on for change. Not to hard on grading, but it makes you better.Definetly take the class!
prefessor keleher is very cool and helps you with all your problemssss!! i learned so much from his class and i became a good paper writerrrr! He knows how to teach!!
Mr. Keleher is a very good teacher. He helps you through everything and teaches you how to do it yourself. I would keep him all four years if I could.
K

He was a wonderful teacher. He gives you as many chances to rewrite your paper as you want. And he TELLS you exactly what to fix. He listens to both sides of an argument and he isn't bias when it comes to argumentative essays. He reads it for quality and doesnt give a bad grade just because he doesnt agree with your view point. I really enjoyed his class and there are many engaging class discussions. He makes you work, but thats so you are prepared for the next level. Great teacher!
He sucks, I hated it. Pompous arrogant guy. I wouldn't take his class.
I actually liked English before I took his class. I could not stand his negative attitude.

Mr. Keleher was a good teacher. He knew his stuff and it was great to be able to rewrite the essays. He is snobby and arrogant. He kind of looks down on you when you answer a question and its wrong. Overall he is willing to help you as long as you attend class.
He is a good teacher..very sarcastic..Lets you rewrtie all of your essays which is a plus..but grades them hard...

Mr. Keleher gave me confidence that I COULD effectively write a paper.  He is extremely helpful and will meet with students whenever necessary.  He is great at responding to student emails.  I wish all profs could be like him!
Even for those who don't enjoy writing, Keleher eases you into it and actually makes it a good experience.
